title: Can I use wordpress to build my site? - Quora

response.answer_text: Yes it is entirely possible to build such a website. Arūnas Liuiza mentioned, you can use custom post types, taxonomies, post meta fields to define extra parameters.  There are some great membership plugins available for WordPress which will allow you to manage members, teams, etc. If it is a website that needs collaboration from teams, then there are also many plugins that will help you do that.  As for search, I would recommend that you build your own search utility that allows users to search by attributes. you can also use Google Site Search feature. If it is possible you can add a meta box at the end of your posts/articles which contains information like category, time, location, people involved, summary, details, reports Then use a php form which allows user to pick any of these options from a drop down menu and type a search term.Example:  Bottom of your post has: Category: News and MediaTime: 12:59 03/26/2012location: NYC, NYPeople Involved: Mark Smith, Sara Black Now a site visitor picks up people involved and types Mark Smith. your script takes them to google site search looking for "People Involved"+"Mark Smith". I know its not ideal but it will work.  It will be best if you hire a professional developer. You can do it yourself too. but a professional developer with experience will be able to tie things together more perfectly. This will create a better user experiences and a better website.

An experienced developer could build you a site like this in WordPress. Content with custom atributes can be done using custom post types and post meta fields.Built in search functionality in WordPress is not very powerful, so this area will require more customization, but it is also possible.As for membership, there are ready-made plugins (http://www.wilsonmattos.com/wordpress-membership-plugins-list-comparison-reviews), a custom system can also be built on top of WordPress native roles system. What payment processor are you planning to use?To sum up, it is definitely achievable, but you should look for an experienced developer, with good understanding of inner workings of the system.

Yes, WordPress is a highly customizable & extendable piece of software that can be used to create virtually any type of website.  The functionality you mention is easily achieved with the right mix of Theme & Plugins. Some plugins to use: Relevanssi - A Better Search - Relevanssi replaces the default search with a partial-match search that sorts results by relevance. It also indexes comments and shortcode content.Members - The most powerful user, role, and capability management plugin for WordPress.Paid Memberships Pro - A revenue-generating machine for membership sites. Unlimited levels with recurring payment, protected content and member management.Custom Post Type UI - Admin UI for creating custom post types and custom taxonomies in WordPressNinja Forms  - Create forms and manage submissions easily with a simple drag and drop interface. Contact forms, subscription forms, or any other form for WordPress.The plugins mentioned above are just a few options that you can use to achieve your goals.

In short yes. Depending upon your skill levels in Wordpress, PHP, HTML, CSS and My-SQL you can do it yourself or get a WordPress professional to work on it. If you do decide to hire a Professional, based on my personal experiences I would recommend you to ensure that the developer fully understands the workflow of the business and how a typical website user would use the website. In fact documentation for the requirements of the website should be created for everyone's clarity.

WordPress indeed is the best CMS to make a Website. I previously used to code but it has limitations especially when you are not an expert. I recommend you to use WordPress if you are not good at coding. Here is a special guide: Why you Should use WordPress Apart from all the other arguments, your WordPress website will be SEO friendly and can focus on other things like marketing and advertising, keeping aside the SEO part on plugins or WordPress itself. Read the guide on Best SEO Plugins: 4 Best SEO Plugins for WordPress Websites

Short answer, yes. Wordpress is a multitude of plugins to help you achieve what you're wanting to do. Best to start by finding yourself a developer experienced using WP and who is building sites, using WP, regularly.
